question.text: Q1. In Railway terminology, "Stores" mainly refers to
question.option: All materials, components and spares held in stock

question.text: Q2. The department responsible for purchase and custody of materials is
Q3. A sub-store or ward store in workshop is normally under the charge of
Q4. A "stock item" in store means
question.option: Item regularly used and kept in stock
Item used only once in lifetime
Item not allowed to be kept in store

question.text: Q5. A "non-stock item" in store is
question.option: An item never to be purchased
Item not regularly used and procured against specific demand

question.text: Q6. Which of the following is most likely a stock item?
question.option: Special test rig for one project

question.text: Q7. Which of the following is most likely a non-stock item?
Q8. A consumable item in store is one which
question.option: Is used up and cannot be reused economically

question.text: Q9. Which of the following is a consumable item?
Q10. A non-consumable item in store is
Q11. Which of the following is a non-consumable item?
Q12. Custody of store items means
question.option: Responsibility for safe keeping and correct accounting
Right to use any item personally

question.text: Q13. Responsibility for quantity and safety of materials in a ward store lies with
Q14. Material in a store is normally kept in
Q15. Identification of material in store is done by
question.option: Stock number, description and bin location

question.text: Q16. A store indent or requisition is
question.option: Demand raised by user department on stores

question.text: Q17. Material receipt at stores is supported by
Q18. Before accepting material into stock, the store must
Q19. Material receipt inspection is done to
Q20. Issue of material from store should be done only against
Q21. To prevent confusion and shortage, issue from store should be
question.option: Entered immediately in bin card and ledger

question.text: Q22. A bin card is maintained
question.option: At the location of material indicating quantity in bin

question.text: Q23. Which record shows both quantity and value of store items?
Q24. Bin card generally records
question.option: Receipts, issues and balance in quantity only

question.text: Q25. Store ledger is usually maintained in
Q26. A "return note" is used when
question.option: Surplus or unused material is returned to store

question.text: Q27. Scrap material from shop is normally sent to
Q28. Surplus store item means
question.option: Item in excess of estimated requirement

question.text: Q29. Obsolete store item means
question.option: Item which is no longer required due to design change

question.text: Q30. Condemnation of non-serviceable items is done by
Q31. Scrap after condemnation is normally disposed by
Q32. Minimum level of stock is
question.option: Level below which stock should not fall

question.text: Q33. Maximum level of stock is
question.option: Highest quantity of stock allowed to avoid overstocking
Level at which purchase is started

question.text: Q34. Re-order level is
question.option: Stock level at which fresh purchase action is initiated

question.text: Q35. Safety stock means
question.option: Extra quantity kept to meet unforeseen demand or delay

question.text: Q36. Overstocking of materials leads to
question.option: Blocking of capital and possible deterioration

question.text: Q37. Understocking of essential items can cause
question.option: Delay in repairs and loss of production

question.text: Q38. ABC analysis of inventory is used for
question.option: Classifying items based on value and usage

question.text: Q39. In ABC analysis, "A" category items are generally
question.option: Few items with high annual consumption value
Many items with very low value

question.text: Q40. FIFO in stores stands for
Q41. FIFO principle is mainly adopted to
question.option: Issue oldest stock first to avoid deterioration

question.text: Q42. Physical stock verification means
question.option: Counting actual quantity and comparing with records

question.text: Q43. Discrepancy between physical stock and book stock should be
question.option: Investigated and adjusted as per rules

question.text: Q44. Shortage in stock found during verification may be due to
Q45. Excess stock found physically over book balance may be due to
question.option: Receipt not posted or wrong issue entry

question.text: Q46. Responsibility for safe storage of inflammable liquids like paint and thinner is of
Q47. For lubricating oil drums, the best storage practice is
question.option: Store in covered, ventilated area with proper supports

question.text: Q48. Corrosion of stored metallic items can be reduced by
question.option: Applying protective coating and keeping dry

question.text: Q49. Material safety data sheets (MSDS) are useful for
question.option: Knowing hazards and safe handling of chemicals

question.text: Q50. For fast-moving items, stores should
question.option: Fix proper minimum and reorder levels

question.text: Q51. Obsolescence of store items can be reduced by
question.option: Better planning and timely review of stock

question.text: Q52. Issue of wrong item from store can be prevented by
question.option: Proper identification and cross-checking with indent

question.text: Q53. In a ward store, tools issued to individual staff are normally recorded in
Q54. Periodic return of tools for inspection helps to
question.option: Ensure tools are in good condition and available

question.text: Q55. Perishable materials with expiry date, like some chemicals, should be
question.option: Issued and used before expiry date

question.text: Q56. In case expired material is found in store
question.option: It should be segregated and processed for disposal

question.text: Q57. A JE in workshop should ensure that issue of store items
question.option: Matches with job requirement and is not excessive

question.text: Q58. Material reconciliation at end of job means
question.option: Comparing total issue with theoretical requirement

question.text: Q59. Excess consumption of material revealed by reconciliation indicates
question.option: Possible wastage, loss or wrong usage

question.text: Q60. Proper store accounting helps mainly in
question.option: Control of cost and prevention of losses

question.text: Q61. In an emergency breakdown, issue of material can be allowed
question.option: With proper authorisation and subsequent regularisation

question.text: Q62. Responsibility for safe custody of portable measuring instruments in a section is of
Q63. Stock verification is usually carried out
question.option: Periodically as per schedule and surprise checks

question.text: Q64. Unauthorised removal of store items is termed as
Q65. To reduce pilferage, stores should have
question.option: Proper locking, control and issue procedures

question.text: Q66. A tool which is beyond repair and not economical to retain should be
Q67. For heavy and costly items, issue from stores is generally
question.option: On written authority of competent officer

question.text: Q68. Insurance of certain high value items during transport helps to
question.option: Protect against financial loss due to damage/loss

question.text: Q69. When a component is returned as scrap, it should be
question.option: Clearly identified and segregated from serviceable items

question.text: Q70. JE should ensure that lifting tackles (slings, chains) in stores are issued only
question.option: If tested and certified for safe working load

question.text: Q71. Proper labelling of bins in store helps in
question.option: Quick and correct identification of materials

question.text: Q72. In case of flammable liquid store, smoking
Q73. Annual stock-taking is mainly done to
question.option: Reconcile physical stock with book balance

question.text: Q74. Stores handling equipment like forklifts and pallets are used to
Q75. For identification of high-value items, stores may use
Q76. Non-moving items in store for long period should be
question.option: Reviewed for future requirement and possible disposal

question.text: Q77. A stock-out situation for critical item can be avoided by
Q78. JE should coordinate with stores mainly to
question.option: Ensure availability of right material at right time

question.text: Q79. For warranty items, store records are important to know
question.option: Date of receipt and usage for claiming warranty

question.text: Q80. Label "Quarantined" on material generally means
Q81. Proper ventilation in store is necessary to
question.option: Prevent deterioration of materials and improve safety

question.text: Q82. JE should discourage hoarding of material at shop level because
question.option: It hides actual requirement and complicates control

question.text: Q83. Issue of tools against tool card ensures
Q84. When new drawing introduces different material, old material in store should be
question.option: Reviewed for alternative use or disposal

question.text: Q85. JE's role in condemnation process is mainly to
Q86. Proper stacking of materials in stores avoids
question.option: Toppling, damage and obstruction of passages

question.text: Q87. Hazardous materials in stores should be identified by
question.option: Warning labels and colour codes as per rules

question.text: Q88. Store accounting helps Accounts department to
question.option: Know value of inventory and control expenditure

question.text: Q89. "Lead time" in stores terminology is
question.option: Time between placing order and receiving material

question.text: Q90. Reorder level is decided based on
question.option: Consumption, lead time and safety stock

question.text: Q91. An item used once in many years, but essential for safety, should be
question.option: Kept with special control as critical item

question.text: Q92. Periodic review of stock levels helps to
Q93. Disposing scrap promptly is important because
question.option: It frees space and realises value

question.text: Q94. JE must ensure that high-value spare like bearings are stored
question.option: In clean, dry place with proper packing

question.text: Q95. Issue of wrong grade of fastener in critical location may
question.option: Lead to failure and affect safety

question.text: Q96. In Railway workshops, stores management directly supports
question.option: Continuous and safe maintenance of rolling stock

question.text: Q97. Proper documentation for condemned items is required to
Q98. Safety in stores is important mainly because
question.option: Many items are heavy, hazardous or flammable

question.text: Q99. JE should treat store items as
question.option: Government property to be used only for official purpose

question.text: Q100. Effective store control finally results in
question.option: Reduced cost, less wastage and better availability of materials
